alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Olomana (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 17 at 3:24AM HST until December 18 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF WARNING CANCELLED FOR ALL SHORES... .A north-northwest (340 degrees) swell will continue to produce large surf today. However, wave period and height will gradually diminish through tonight, reducing the threat for significant shoreline impacts. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet, except 18 to 24 feet along north facing shores of Oahu * WHERE...North facing shores of the Big Island and Oahu. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out. Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts.

area.areaDesc: Big Island East; Big Island North; Olomana
